item.title: Linear regression - Must knows
item.description: Linear regression is one of the easiest and first taught models. But there is more to the algorithm than it appears. Given its simplicity, it is often abused. In this article, let’s get some facts straight about the algorithm. Must-knows about linear regression: Linear regression derives a trend line that best fits the data There should be linear relationship between response variable & predictors and predictors shouldn’t be correlated Residuals (Actual - Fitted) should be normally distributed, have constant variance and shouldn’t be autocorrelated.

item.title: Cryptocurrency analysis - What to trade?
item.description: I recently developed a rudimentary method to identify the potential cryptocurrencies to BUY and trade. I did this exercise for Gramener’s blog. Reposting the same below. item.title: Excel must knows
item.description: Microsoft Excel is a godsend for anyone who want to analyze and visualize data. In this article let’s look at some of the must-knows of excel to get started. Anyone who wishes to master excel should know the following aspects: Navigation using shortcuts - Boosts productivity by atleast 20% Pivot tables - Aggregates and unlocks the relationships between variables Formulas - Help derive new metrics, define KPIs, transform and quantify variables Visualization - Make sense of the data through a visual aid Solver - Advanced optimization with ease Alt, Ctrl and Shift are your friends when it comes to navigating around in excel Keyboard shortcuts help you move around in excel without using mouse.

item.title: Getting started with Data Science
item.description: Knowing SQL, R/Python, Excel & Powerpoint will get the data science engine started Data scientist is the sexiest job of 21st century. Below given are some tools that a newbie in data science should get familiar with: Excel - Can’t stress enough, but this is a must and should! SQL, R, Python - R (or) Python should suffice. It never hurts to have both in pocket. Power point, Tableau, Power BI Sublime text editor, Dropbox paper Databases & Websites are crucial sources of data Almost all the companies, small and big, keep their data in databases.
